Published for the Early English Text Society by Humphrey Milford, Oxford University Press
<name>Published for the Early English Text Society by Humphrey Milford, Oxford University Press</name>
<description type="note">Preliminaries and introductory material omitted<lb/>The following plays have been taken from this source:</description>

<description type="note">Copyright (c) 1922, Early English Text Society. This text may not be reproduced, except for fair dealing purposes, without the express permission of Chadwyck-Healey and the copyright holder.</description>
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
<description type="note">Square brackets represent sections of the textwhich have been deleted or added at different stages in the evolution of the manuscript.</description>

Contemplacio Sovereynes ?e han sen shewyd ?ow be-fore Of Joachym and Anne here botherys holy metynge How our lady was conseyvid and how she was bore We passe ovyr þat breffnes of tyme consyderynge And how our lady in here tendyr age and ?yng In to þe temple was offryd and so forth proced Þis sentens sayd xal be hire be-gynnyng now þe modyr of mercy in þis be our sped. And as a childe of iij ?ere age here she xal appere to alle pepyl þat ben here present and of here grett grace now xal ?e here how she levyd evyr to goddys entent with grace That holy matere we wole declare tyl ffortene ?ere how sche dyd fare Now of ?our speche I pray ?ow spare all þat ben in þis place. here joachym and Anne with oure lady betwen hem beyng al in whyte as a childe of iij ?ere age presente here in to þe temple thus seying joachym. Joachim Blyssyd be oure lord ffayr ffrute haue we now Anne wyff remembyr wole ?e Þat we made to god an holy a-vow Þat oure fyrst childe þe servaunt of god xulde be The Age of mary oure dowtere is ?erys thre Þer fore to thre personys and on god lete us here present þe ?onger she be drawyn þe bettyr semyth me and for teryeng of our a-vow of god we myth be shent. Anne it is as ?e sey husbond in dede late us take mary our dowtere us be-twen and to þe temple with here procede Dowtere þe Aungel tolde us ?e xulde be a qwen Wole ?e go se þat lord ?our husbond xal ben and lerne for to love hym and lede with hym ?our lyff telle ?our ffadyr and me her ?our answere let sen Wole ?e be pure maydyn and also goddys wyff. Maria Ffadyr and modyr if it plesyng to ?ow be ?e han mad ?our a-vow so sothly wole I to be goddys chast seruaunt whil lyff is in me but to be goddys wyff I was nevyr wurthy I am þe sympelest þat evyr was born of body I haue herd ?ow seyd God xulde haue a modyr swete þat I may leve to se hire god graunt me for his mercy and Abyl me to ley my handys vndyr hire fayr fete. Et genuflectet Ad deum. Joachym I-Wys dowtere it is wel seyd ?e answere and ?e were twenty ?ere olde. Anne whith ?our speche mary I am wel payd can ?e gon a-lone lett se beth bolde. Maria To go to goddys hous wole ?e now be-holde I am joyful thedyrward as I may be. Joachym Wyff I ryght joyful oure dowtere to be-holde. Anne So am I wys husbond now in goddys name go we. Joachym Sere prince of prestes and it plese ?ow we þat were barreyn god hath sent a childe to offre here to goddys service we mad oure avow here is þe same mayde mary most mylde. Isakar Joachym I haue good mende how I ?ow revyled I am ryght joyful þat god hath ?ove ?ow þis grace to be amonge fruteful now be ?e reconsylid Com swete mary com ?e haue a gracyous face. Joachym flectendo Ad deum sic dicens Joachym Now Ffadyr and sone and holy gost on god and personys thre we offre to þe lorde of myghtys most Oure dowtere þi servaunt evyr more to be. Anna Ther to most bounde evyr more be we Mary in þis holy place leve ?ow we xall In goddys name now up go ?e oure fadyr oure prest lo doth ?ow call. Maria Modyr and it plese ?ow fyrst wole I take my leve of my fadyr and ?ow my modyr i-wys I haue a fadyr in hefne þis I be-leve now good ffadyr with þat fadyr ?e me blysse. Joachym In nomine patris et filii et spiritus sancti. Maria Amen Now ?e good modyr. Anne In nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti Maria Amen. Maria Now oure lord thank ?ow for this here is my fadyr and my modyr bothe most mekely I beseche I may ?ow kys now for-?eve me yf evyr I made ?ow wrothe. Et explexendo osculabit patrem et matrem. Joachym Nay dowtere ?e offendyd nevyr god nor man lovyd be þat lord ?ow so doth kepe. Anne Swete dowtyr thynk on ?our modyr An ?our swemynge smytyht to myn hert depe. [Maria] Ffadyr and modyr I xal pray for ?ow and wepe To god with al myn hert specyaly blysse me day and nyght evyr her ?e slepe good ffadyr and modyr and beth mery. Joachym A ho had evyr suche a chylde nevyr creature ?it þat evyr was bore Sche is so gracyous she is so mylde so xulde childyr to fadyr and modyr evyr more. Anne Than xulde thei be blyssyd and plese god sore husbond and it plese ?ow not hens go we xal tyl mary be in þe temple above thore I wold not for al erthe se here fal. Episcopus Come gode mary come babe I þe call þi pas pratyly to þis plas pretende þou xalt be þe dowtere of god Eternall If þe fyftene grees þou may Ascende It is meracle if þou do now god þe dyffende Ffrom babylony to hevynly jherusalem þis is þe way Every man þat thynk his lyff to Amende þe fiftene psalmys in memorye of þis mayde say. Maria Maria et sic deinceps usque ad fine xvc i m psalmorum. The fyrst degre gostly applyed It is holy desyre with god to be In trobyl to god I haue cryed And in sped þat lord hath herde me. Ad dominum cum tribularer clamaui et exaudiuit me. The secunde is stody with meke inquysissyon veryly How I xal haue knowynge of godys wylle To þe mownteynes of hefne I haue lyfte myn ey Ffrom qwens xal comyn helpe me tylle. Leuaui oculos meos in montes vnde ueniat auxilium mihi. The thrydde is gladnes in mende in hope to be that we xall be savyd all thus I am glad of these tydyngys ben seyd to me now xal we go in to goddys hous. Letatus sum in hijs que dicta sunt mihi: in domum domini ibimus. The fourte is meke obedyence as is dette to hym þat is a-bove þe planetys sefne to þe I haue myn eyn sette þat dwellys above þe skyes in hefne. Ad te leuaui oculos meos qui habitas in celis. The ffyfte is propyr confessyon þat we be nought with-owth god thus but god in vs haue habytacion Per aventure oure enemyes shulde swelle vs. Nisi quia dominus erat in nobis dicat nunc israel nisi quia dominus erat in nobis. The sexte is confidens in goddys strenght A-lon Ffor of all grace from hym comyth þe strem they þat trust in god as þe mownt syon he xal not be steryd endles þat dwellyth in jherusalem. Qui confidunt in domino sicut mons Syon: non commouebitur in eternum qui habitat in hierusalem. The sefte is vndowteful hope of immortalyte In oure lorde is as gracy and mercy Whan oure lord conuertyth oure captiuite Than Are we mad as joyful mery. In conuertendo dominus captiuitatem syon facti sumus sicut consolati. The eyted is contempt of veynglory in vs Ffor hym þat Al mankende hath multyplyed But yf oure lord make here oure hous they An laboryd in veyn þat it han Edyfied. Nisi dominus edificauerit domum in uanum laborauerunt qui edificant eam. The nynte is a childely fer in dede With A longyng love in oure lord þat ay is blyssyd Arn All they þat god drede Whiche þat gon in his holy weys. Beati omnes qui timent dominum: qui ambulant in vijs eius. The tende is myghty soferauns of carnal temptacion ffor þe fleschly syghtys ben fers and fel ofte ?ough is ffowth with with suech vexacion þou seynge god say so clepyd israel. Sepe expugnauerunt me a iuuentute mea dicat nunc israel. The Elefnte is accusatyff confessyon of iniquite Of which ful noyous is þe noyis Fro depnes lord I haue cryed to the Lord here in sped my sympyl voys. De profundis clamaui ad te domine: domine exaudi uocem meam. The twelfte is mekenes þat is fayre and softe In mannys sowle with-inne and with-owte Lord myn herte is not heyued on lofte nyn myn eyn be not lokynge a-bowte. Domine non est exaltatum cor meum neque elati sunt oculi mei. The Threttene is ffeyth þer with with holy dedys don expresse haue mende lorde of davyth And of All his swettnes. Memento domine dauid et omnis mansuetudinis eius. The ffourtene is brothyrly concorde i-wys þat norchyth love of creaturys echon Se how good and how glad it is bretheryn ffor to dwelle in on. Ecce quam bonum et quam jocundum habitare fratres in vnum. The ffyftene is gracyous with on Acorde whiche is syne of godly love semyth me se now blysse oure lord All þat oure lordys servauntys be. Ecce nunc benedicite dominum omnes serui dominj. Episcopus A gracyous lord þis is A mervelyous thynge þat we se here all in syght A babe of thre ?er age so ?ynge to come vp þese grecys so vp-ryght It is An hey meracle and by goddys myght no dowth of she xal be gracyous. Maria Holy ffadyr I be-seche ?ow forth ryght Sey how I xal be rewlyd in goddys hous. Episcopus Dowtere god hath ?ovyn vs comaundementys ten Which shortely to say be comprehendyd in tweyn and þo must be kept of all crysten men or ellys here jugement is perpetual peyn ?e muste love god severeynly and ?our evyn crystyn pleyn god fyrst ffor his hy? and sovereyn dygnyte he lovyd ?ow fyrst love hym a-geyn ffor of love to his owyn lyknes he made the. Love ffadyr sone and holy gost Love god þe fadyr ffor he gevyth myght Love god þe sone ffor he gevyth wysdam þou wost Love god þe holy gost ffor he gevyth love and lyght thre personys and on god þus love of ryght with all þin hert with all þi sowle with all þi mende and with all þe strenghthis in þe be-dyght þan love þin evyn crystyn as þi self with-owtyn ende. Thu xalt hate no thynge but þe devyl and synne god byddyth the lovyn þi bodyly enmy And as for ?our self here þus xal ?e be-gynne ?e must serve and wurchep god here dayly Ffor with pray?er with grace and mercy Se the haue A resonable tyme to fede thanne to haue a labour bodyly þat þer in be gostly and bodely mede. ?our A-bydynge xal be with ?our maydenys ffyve Swyche tyme as ?e wole haue consolacion. Maria This lyff me lyketh as my lyve of here namys I be-seche ?ow to haue informacion. Episcopus There is þe fyrst meditacion Contryssyon compassyon And clennes And þat holy mayde fruyssyon With these blyssyd maydenes xal be ?our besynes. Maria Here is an holy ffelacheppe I fele I am not wurthy Amonge hem to be Swete systerys to ?ow All I knele To receyve me I be-seche ?our charyte. Episcopus They xal dowtere And on þe tothere syde se ther ben sefne prestys in dede to schryve to teche and to mynystryn to the to lerne þe goddys lawys and scrypture to rede. Maria Ffadyr knew I here namys wele were I. Episcopus Ther is dyscressyon devocion dylexcion and deliberacion they xal tende upon ?ow besyly With declaracion determynacion dyvynacion Now go ?e maydenys to ?our occupacion And loke ?e tende þis childe tendyrly and ?e serys knelyth and I xal gyve ?ow goddys benyson in nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti. Et recedent cum ministris suis omnes virgines dicent Amen. [Maria] To ?ow ffadyr and modyr I me comende blyssyd be þe tyme ?e me hedyr brought. Joachym Dowtere þe ffadere of oure feyth þe mot defende as he of his myght made all thynge of nowth. Anne Mary to þi sowle solas he sende In whos wysdam all þis werd was wrought. go we now hens husbonde so hende Hic joachim et anna recedent domum. for owth of care now are we brought. Maria Be þe holy gost at hom be ?e brought Systerys ?e may go do what ?e xall Ad virgines to serve god fyrst here is al my thought Be-forn þis holy awtere on my knes I fall. Lord sefne petycions I be-seche ?ow of here Ffyrst þat I may kepe þi love and þi lawe Þe secunde to lovyn myn evyn crystyn as my self dere Þe thrydde from all þat þou hatyst me to with-drawe The fourte All vertuys to þi plesauns knawe Þe fyfte to obey þe ordenaryes of þe temple echon Þe sexte and þat all pepyl may serve þe with Awe þat in þis holy temple fawte be non. The sefnte lord I haske with grett ffere þat I may se onys in my lyve þat lady þat xal goddys sone bere þat I may serve here with my wyttys fyve If it plese ?ow and ellys it is not þer with to stryve with prayers prostrat ffor þese gracys I wepe O my god devocion depe in me dryve þat myn hert may wake in þe thow my body slepe. here þe Aungel bryngyth manna in A cowpe of gold lyke to confeccions þe hefne syngynge þe Aungel seyth Merveyle not mekest maydon of my mynystracion I am a good Aungel sent of god All myght With Aungelys mete Ffor ?our Sustentacion ?e to receyve it Ffor Natural myght We Aungellys xul serve ?ow day and nyght now fede ?ow þer-with in goddys name we xal lerne ?ow þe lyberary of oure lordys lawe lyght ffor my sawys in ?ow shewyth sygnes of shame. Maria To thank oure soveryen lord not sufficyth my mende I xal fede me of þis fode my lord hath me sent All maner of savowrys in þis mete I fynde I felt nevyr non so swete ner so redolent. Angelus Eche day þer with ?e xal be content Aunge alle howrys xal to ?ow apere. Maria Mercy my makere how may þis be ment I am þe sympelest creature þat is levynge here. Angelus In ?our name Maria ffyve letterys we han M. Mayde most mercyfull and mekest in mende A. Auerte of þe Anguysch þat Adam began R. Regina of regyon Reyneng with-owtyn ende I. Innocent be Influens of Jesses kende A. Aduocat most Autentyk ?our Antecer Anna hefne and helle here kneys down bende Whan þis holy name of ?ow is seyd Maria. Maria I qwake grettly for dred to here þis comendacion Good swete Aungel why wole ?e sey thus. Aungell Ffor ?e xal here aftere haue A salutacion þat xal þis excede it is seyd Amonge vs The deyte þat dede xal determyn and dyscus ?e xal nevyr lady be lefte here A-lone. Maria I Crye þe mercy lorde and þin erthe Cus recomendynge me to þat godhyd þat is tryne in trone. his osculet terram here xal comyn Allwey An Aungel with dyvers presentys goynge and comyng and in þe tyme þei xal synge in hefne þis hympne Jhesu corona virginum And After þer comyth A minister fro þe busschop with A present and seyth Minister Prynce of oure prestes Ysakare be name he hath sent ?ow hym self his servyce in dede And bad ?e xulde ffede ?ow spare for no shame In þis tyme of mete ne lenger ?e rede. Maria Recomende me to my fadyr sere and god do hym mede These vesselys A-?en sone I xal hym sende I xal bere it my systerys I trowe þei haue more nede goddys foyson is evyr to his servauntys hendyr þan we wende. Systerys oure holy ffadyr isakare Hath sent us hese servyce here ryght now Ffede ?ow þer of hertyly I pray ?ow nat spare and if owght be leve specyaly I pray ?ow That þe pore men þe relevys þer of haue now Ffayn and I myth I wolde do þe dedys of mercy Pore ffolk ffaryn god knowyth how On hem evyr I haue grett pety. Contemplacio lo sofreynes here ?e haue seyn in þe temple of oure ladyes presentacion she was nevyr occapyed in thyngys veyn but Evyr besy in holy ocupacyon And we be-seche ?ow of ?oure pacyens þat we pace þese materys so lythly Away If þei xulde be do with good prevydens Eche on wolde suffyce ffor An hool day Now xal we procede to here dissponsacion which Aftere þis was xiiij ?ere tyme sufficyth not to make pawsacion hath pacyens with vs we be-sech ?ow her And in short spas The parlement of hefne sone xal ?e se and how goddys sone com man xal he And how þe salutacion Aftere xal be be goddys holy gras.
